ref: 5154 jarjára ʻ decayed, torn, broken ʼ MBh. [~*jhar- jhara -- 3. -- &rcirclemacr Pa. jajjara -- ʻ feeble with age, withered ʼ; Pk. jajjara<-> ʻ worn out, in holes ʼ; Wg. ǰeǰalä ʻ ill ʼ; K. zŏzuru ʻ decayed, withered ʼ, zazuru m. ʻ withered grass or leaves or vegetables ʼ (< *jārjara -- ?); H. jājarā ʻ old, infirm, worn out ʼ; OG. jājaraüṁ ʻ old ʼ, G. jājrũ ʻ poor, wretched ʼ; <-> Ku. jĩjaro, jijaro ʻ old, worn out, shattered, leaky ʼ X jino < jīrṇá -- . -- Si. däduru ʻ rent, crack ʼ EGS 74 rather < dardara -- .
